title: Srimad Bhagavatam | Sri Mahotsaha Chaitanya Dasa | SB 1.19.1 | 17.11.2024
speaker: HG Amitasana Dasa

segments.text: Reading from Srimad Bhagavatam, Canto 1, Chapter 19, Text No. 1
Reading from Srimad Bhagavatam, Canto 1, Chapter 19, Text No. 1
Reading from Srimad Bhagavatam, Canto 1, Chapter 19, Text No. 1
A pious king regretted his accidental improper treatment of the powerful brahmana who was faultless.
Such repentance is natural for a good man like the king,
and such repentance delivers a devotee from all kinds of sins accidentally committed.
Accidental sins committed by a devotee are sincerely regretted
In the face of the Lord, all sins unwillingly committed by a devotee
are burnt in the fire of repentance.
So the last week, one of the important news has been
that the next year in 2025, early 2025,
there is going to be a world's cricket tournament,
which is supposed to be hosted by Pakistan and to be played in Pakistan.
So India has raised objections that they don't want to send their team to Pakistan
due to security reasons and also due to the tensions, political tension,
which is existing between, prevailing between the two countries.
And Pakistan is adamant, they want the tournament to happen there only
They are demanding ICC, that it should go on whether they come or don't come,
whether India participates or not participates.
But if India does not participate, then there will be a huge revenue loss
because everyone, India is the most populated country in the world
and has the most crazy cricket fans, everyone wants to watch Indian team.
If India doesn't play, the viewership goes down.
So why I am sharing this is because we can see there is this fight happening
at an international level between nations.
So the nature of Kali Yuga is, the Kali Yuga is even famous as the age of quarrel.
So there exists fight at so many levels on Kali Yuga,
Society to society, community to community, and even nation, state to state.
We also know how here, Kannada, we have to, Kannadigas want people to talk Kannada.
Others don't want, they don't want to learn Kannada, so there is tension.
And nation to nation, as we have seen here.
And therefore, it is so difficult,
for people to live together, even within a family,
you know, or for friends, and for communities, to live together,
accepting each other's differences and to stay without fighting is such a difficult thing.
exemplary devotees, narrations of the exemplary devotees,
has given us practical demonstration of how we can live peacefully in this world,
even in the current age of Kali,
if we practice the principles mentioned in Srimad Bhagavatam.
And based on these principles of Srimad Bhagavatam,
Srimad Bhagavatam, based on these principles of Srimad Bhagavatam,
only Srila Prabhupada started the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.
It is an international society, coming together of the devotee people from all parts of the world,
all race, caste, creed, religion, colour,
coming together for the purpose of Krishna Consciousness and staying together.
It's also said ISKCON is also famously it is coined that Srila Prabhupada built ISKCON
when Srila Prabhupada built a house in which the whole world can live.
So Prabhupada in fact defines the purpose of starting ISKCON.
It is mentioned in Srimad Bhagavatam 4th Canto 12th Chapter 48.
In the context of Drona Maharaj and Drona Maharaj's character and activities.
In the end of that narration where Maitreya Rishi is narrating this.
He says, Prabhupada says in the purport.
It is said that only in the association of devotees can one understand the importance of the character.
And pastimes of the supreme personality of Godhead or his devotees.
It is especially recommended that Drona Maharaj's character be discussed in a society of the twice born.
Which refers to the qualified Brahmanas, Kshatriyas and Vaishyas.
One should especially seek the society of Brahmanas who are elevated to the position of Vaishnavas.
The discussion of Srimad Bhagavatam which describes the character and pastimes of devotees and the Lord is very quickly effective.
The international society for Krishna consciousness has been organized for this purpose.
In every center of this society, not only in the morning, evening or noon.
There is continuous devotional service going on.
Anyone who comes into contact with the society automatically becomes a devotee.
We have actual experience that many Karmis and others come to the society.
And find a very pleasing and peaceful atmosphere in the temples of ISKCON.
The word Dvijanmanam means one of the twice born.
Anyone can join the international society for Krishna consciousness.
And be initiated to become twice born.
So Prabhupada opened up this opportunity for all of us.
For anyone who agrees to practice the principles of Krishna consciousness.
And be in the association of devotees.
To become initiated and to become twice born.
And that is the purpose of ISKCON.
So therefore we see in the association of devotees.
One can stay together despite the nature of Kali Yuga which is full of quarrel and fight.
So it is possible to mature in devotional service only in the association of devotees.
Therefore there is one more statement of Srila Prabhupada where Prabhupada says.
That if one thinks that one can advance in devotional service or Krishna consciousness.
To think that I can advance by myself living alone.
I don't need any association of devotees.
It is possible only in living in association of devotees.
But then when we live with some devotees.
When we live or when we stay with different people.
